text:
Q: Should equality operators be implemented on the type itself, or is it acceptable to implement them once using C# 14 extension operators? A:

I made a mistake in the previus answer. Today I updated vs2026 to 18.1.0 and this warning only appears when the instance Equals method is overridden. I don't know if it existed before the update. Moreover, I also noticed that if the extension class is placed in a namespace, to use this operator, the using NAMESPACE statement must be used. And it seems that currently there is no use of extension operators in the dotnet/runtime project. So, at this stage I think the answer is no.

Q: Why doesn't Google Chrome allow using custom root certificate authorities for HTTP/3 + QUIC? A:

The installer doesn't. The antivirus program would buy a certificate from a root authority that is already trusted. Also, such products are questionable in terms of privacy. Which is good reason why they should have trusted, verifiable certificates.

Q: Why would 'git submodule update' skip a submodule? A:

In my case, I needed to remove update = none for a given submodule in .gitmodules. I did, but I still got the "Skipping..." message.

Turns out, that after you remove the update = none from .gitmodules, you also need to remove that line from .git/config for the same submodule, where it gets stuck.
